formal.title: Job Application
formal.question: You saw an advertisement for a [remote internship] at [Company] on [platform]. Write an email applying for the position. Explain why you are suitable, mention availability, and ask about the next steps.
writingPoints: reference to the advert and position

styles.default:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing with reference to your advertisement for the position of [remote internship], which I saw on [platform]. I would like to apply because the role closely matches my interests in [field] and my experience in [skill area].

During the past [time period], I have been involved in [project/course/job], where my duties included [duty 1] and [duty 2]. This has helped me develop strong organisational skills, attention to detail and the ability to meet deadlines. Furthermore, I am confident using [tools/software] and I work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

I would be available to start on [date] and can commit [hours] per week. Could you please let me know what the next stage of the selection process is, and whether you require any additional documents beyond my CV?

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours faithfully,
[Full Name]

formal.title: Requesting Information
formal.question: You are interested in enrolling in a [professional course] at [Institute]. Write an email requesting information about fees, timetable and entry requirements.

styles.default:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I am writing to enquire about the [professional course] offered by [Institute]. I am considering applying for the next intake and would like to request further details before making a final decision.

Could you please tell me what the total fees are, and whether there are any additional costs for materials or exams? I would also like to know the typical timetable, particularly whether lessons are scheduled in the evenings or at weekends.

In addition, would it be possible to clarify the entry requirements? In particular, I would appreciate information on whether applicants need [qualification/English level] or relevant work experience.

Thank you for your assistance. I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours faithfully,
[Full Name]
styles.alternative1:
Dear Admissions Team,

I am contacting you to request information regarding your [professional course]. I am interested in enrolling and would be grateful for a few practical details.

First of all, could you confirm the tuition fee and any extra charges (such as registration or exam costs)? Secondly, would you mind explaining how the weekly schedule is organised and how many hours of teaching are included?

Finally, I would appreciate clarification about the entry requirements, especially whether a specific qualification or language certificate is necessary.

Thank you very much for your time.

Yours faithfully,
[Full Name]
styles.alternative2:

Could you please provide details of the fees and any additional costs? I would also like to know the timetable, including the days and times of classes. In addition, could you let me know what the entry requirements are?

formal.title: Comparing and Recommending
formal.question: Your teacher asked you to compare two options for a study trip: staying with a host family or in a student residence. Write an email comparing both and recommending one option.

styles.default:
Dear [Title] [Surname],

I am writing in response to your request to compare accommodation options for our study trip: a host family and a student residence.

On the one hand, host families provide cultural immersion and frequent opportunities to practise English naturally. This is likely to improve confidence and fluency. They may also include meals, reducing costs.

On the other hand, a student residence is predictable and convenient, with easy access to facilities and clear organisation. However, students may socialise mainly within the group, which can limit contact with local speakers.

Taking everything into account, I would recommend host families, provided placements are carefully matched and travel time is reasonable. Overall, the language benefits outweigh the practical advantages of a residence.

Yours sincerely,
[Full Name]
styles.alternative1:
Dear [Title] [Surname],

As requested, I am comparing host families and a student residence for the trip. Both options are workable, but one better supports our learning aims.

Host families offer daily contact with local culture and natural English. By contrast, a residence provides independence, reliable facilities and simpler administration.

In my view, the main purpose of the trip is language development. Therefore, host families are more beneficial, as they encourage genuine interaction beyond the classroom.

For these reasons, I suggest choosing host families, while ensuring students can request suitable placements (dietary needs, quiet environment, distance).

Yours sincerely,
[Full Name]
styles.alternative2:
Dear [Title] [Surname],

I am writing to compare host families and a student residence.

Host families help students practise English every day and learn about local life. A residence is easier to organise and offers more independence, but it can reduce contact with local people.

I recommend host families because they provide better language practice and a more authentic experience.

Yours sincerely,
[Full Name]

formal.title: Explaining and Justifying
formal.question: You missed a deadline for [assignment/task]. Write an email to [your tutor/manager] apologising, explaining what happened, and proposing a solution.

styles.default:
Dear [Title] [Surname],

I am writing to apologise for not submitting [assignment/task] by the deadline on [date]. I fully understand that this may have caused inconvenience.

The reason for this delay is that [brief factual reason]. Although I attempted to resolve the situation immediately, it took longer than expected. I take full responsibility for not informing you earlier.

To address this, I have completed the main work and can submit the final version by [new date]. I would be grateful if you could confirm whether this is acceptable, or suggest an alternative arrangement.

Thank you for your understanding.

Yours sincerely,
[Full Name]
